attributes.action: Commence an urgent review of the Child Maintenance Service Policies/Procedures.
attributes.background: The service levels offered by the Child Maintenance Service are exceptionally poor, staff are unhelpful and do not carry out instructions within reasonable timescales.  Also, the use of Gross Income in the calculations is unfair and takes no account of paying parents financial circumstances.
attributes.additional_details: I have suffered from numerous issues created by this agency and am being financially disadvantaged by them and I am sure I am not alone.  Whilst the majority of paying parents have no issue paying maintenance, it is unfair and unjust that payments do not take into account the financial circumstances of either the paying or the receiving parent.

attributes.action: Ban cold calling, automated message calling, and cold texting or emailing
attributes.background: We are all tired of answering the 'phone and it is a cold caller you didn't want to hear from or didn't request, or it's an automated message telling us about the latest government initiative for windows or whatever.  Add the calls or emails or texts about an accident that you may/may not have had.
attributes.additional_details: I am a personal injury, clinical negligence and professional negligence solicitor and I am fed up with people wanting to "help" me when really I'm just another number to try and make money from.

attributes.action: Help London workers and locals be home owners: restrict multi-property buying.
attributes.background: London house prices keep soaring, and only wealthy UK and foreign investors benefit as they buy up the capital, at prices only they can afford. Home owning is unattainable for locals and workers living in the capital, making renting their only option. Again, rents are high and saving to buy is hard.
attributes.additional_details:
Laws need to be put into place to restrict mass buying from wealthy individuals, as well control on companies.
London is driven by its workers/locals but house prices are causing people to leave to other cities. Plus those commuting into London are being pushed further out as the outskirts also become unaffordable. 
This petition urges the Government implement laws to help more people become home owners in the Capital, and restrict the benefits to investors raking in ridiculous rental income!

attributes.action: All public transport buses to have seat belts.
attributes.background: I have seen many videos on social media of buses in road accidents. Passengers fly out of their seats. Young children fly out of their seats. I for one will not be taking my child on a bus until they have seat belts fitted. A bus is no different to a car. In fact it's probably worse.

attributes.action: Compel Bacs to process payments over a maximum 1-day execution time
attributes.background: In 2007 the EU declared rapid payments essential for a modern and properly functioning economy, adding that there is no reason why payments should not be made by the end of the next business day at the latest. Why, then, nine years later, does Bacs still take three days to process payments?
attributes.additional_details: In 2016, 3-day payments should be redundant. For an electronic payment to take 3 days to process is unacceptable. A cheque which clears on the fourth day is barely any slower. And yet, Bacs is the only option for direct debits, the only RTI-enabled option for payroll payments, and the entrenched option for all other payments. There was no reason in 2007, and there remains no reason today, why all these payments should not be processed over a maximum 1-day execution time, by default.

attributes.action: Introduce PR to resolve the deep divisions created by the EU referendum.
attributes.background: Self-explanatory
attributes.additional_details: The referendum demanded a single answer to a complex question, was unbalanced in terms of outcome (one being final) and was decided by a narrow margin.

attributes.action: Full disclosure of Brexit negotiation & allowing a public referendum on the deal
attributes.background: The undersigned insist that David Davis or his successor & any persons that are involved will fully & openly disclose all details of the Brexit deal in detail they have negotiated. We also call on the government to allow the general public a vote on the negotiated deal as its them that are effected.
attributes.additional_details: We believe that it is only fair and right to allow them a vote on the deal that is negotiated in their name as it was back when we joined. People have the right to decide if the deal is the best for the country and the best way the country should go. We would also like to see the implementation of a set percentage of voters that will have to vote and carry the vote say 75% of the entire voting population with at least a 75% turn out of voting population in the UK and its territories.

attributes.action: Allow Spouses of Work Permit Holders to apply for ILR based on Domestic Violence
attributes.background: In June 2016,I finally sought help about the Domestic Violence against me. It was just 1 month before my husband would have obtained his Indefinite Leave to Remain(ILR). He now has a criminal record and may not get ILR. I am not eligible to apply for DV ILR because he is neither British nor Settled
attributes.additional_details: Under UK Immigration Law, only partners of British nationals/settled persons facing domestic violence (DV) can apply for settlement.This law forces people with abusive immigrant partners to stay on in the marriage.I have worked in the UK as a legal adviser for 5+ years but endured intense DV.I spoke out a month before my immigrant spouse would have acquired settlement.Now, I cannot apply for settlement for myself/2 kids born in the UK, just because I did not endure violence for yet another month

attributes.action: A tenant should not be evicted, after expiry of the tenancy without any reason.
attributes.background: A tenant usually sign tenancy agreement for 12 months, but after the expiry of the tenancy agreement, landlord issues him 2 month's Section 21 Notice and evict him by county court order. This destroys the family life of the tenant. He needs to struggle again to establish a normal family life.

attributes.action: To establish a new bank holiday for the UK to be named "UK Diversity Day".
attributes.background: This day should be celebrated across the UK celebrating the contribution of the many diverse groups across a number of strands of UK society including Age, Disability, Gender, LGBT, Race and Religion. We are a great nation with a great history of embracing diversity and we should celebrate that.

attributes.action: Instigate a root & branch review of The FA
attributes.background: Following the dismal performances of the senior England football team in the European Championships it is time for an effective review of The FA and in particular the senior England set up.
attributes.additional_details: Having failed to qualify for the European championships in 2008 a root and branch review was allegedly carried out. This has clearly had no long lasting effect on the organisation and this  petition is to request that Tracey Crouch MP, Minister for Sport brings pressure upon the FA to carry out a full review of the circumstances surrounding the failings during this championship. This should include selection of inappropriate squad players.

attributes.action: If a fathers name isn't on the birth certificate women shouldn't claim CSA
attributes.background: If women chose not to put the fathers name on the birth certificate they SHOULDN'T have the right to claim CSA unless both parents are on the certificate

attributes.action: Bring in informed consent legislation for elections and referendums.
attributes.background: It is currently legal for political bodies to use false or misleading information in the run up to a vote. Introducing Free, Prior, Informed Consent(FPIC) legislation for elections would hold politicians accountable for misleading or manipulating voters as well as make sure people are aware of risks
attributes.additional_details: Many voters have said they did not fully understand the EU referendum. Politicians used false figures and misleading information in official campaigns to manipulate voters’ decisions. This impinges on voters’ right to self-determination, because they were not fully informed. There is legislation to protect the same rights in other professions, there should also be similar ones for politics and government.

attributes.action: A highly experienced business figure should lead UK exit negotiations with EU
attributes.background: Given the extreme importance of negotiating the best possible exit for the UK from the EU, the government should employ the services of a highly experienced, independent business figure to lead & manage the negotiations. We need the best person for the job who is unlikely to be a politician.

attributes.action: Allow business owners the option of allowing their customers to smoke indoors.
attributes.background: With people endorsing Brexit, it is abundantly clear that people are fed up with government intervention in their lives. By repealing the in-door smoking ban for businesses, trade would increase, especially in the cold months.

attributes.action: Mandatory and timely parliamentary debates for petitions with 100,000 signatures
attributes.background: Currently, petitions that reach 100,000 signatures do not require parliamentary debates. This is an inadequate and undemocratic response. Concerns expressed by large numbers of citizens, should invoke mandatory, timely parliamentary debates

attributes.action: Allow Tunbridge Wells a referendum to separate from the UK alongside Scotland.
attributes.background:
Tunbridge Wells voted in favour of remaining as part of the EU against the trend of the rest of the country.

Please allow Tunbridge Wells an independence referendum (along the lines of the inevitable Scottish Referendum for independence) so that it can renegotiate itself back into the EU.

attributes.action: Poll Leave the EU Voters their reasons and present this to the EU before Brexit.
attributes.background: Anti-EU sentiment is not exclusive to the UK. With a Brexit, it is clear the EU will need to implement reforms to prevent other Nations from following suit. Why wait for the UK to leave the EU before reforming? Poll those who voted Leave for their reasons (it is currently not clear). Present these.
attributes.additional_details:
The EU should use this poll result of Leave voters to present reforms. The UK can then vote again that with these reforms, do we still want to leave the EU? 

Some may argue that David Cameron already asked for reforms. However, it is clear few really actually believed the UK would vote to leave. Now that it is clear, ask why the people voted this way and the EU should present new reforms. 

EU reforms will need to come. The EU has the chance now to do so before a Brexit actually happens.

attributes.action: Continue a pro immigration policy and recognise the value migrants bring the UK
attributes.background: As part of the EU exit negotiations the UK government should seek a deal that will maintain the current rights of all EU citizens in the UK and that will keep the UK border open to economic migrants and refugees alike.
attributes.additional_details:
In addition the UK government should take steps to fully explain to the public the great benefits that migration brings to the UK.

A large number of people who voted to leave in the recent referendum will have done so as a rejection of the federalist agenda of the EU and in favour of national sovereignty and democracy. They did not vote for a rejection of migrants or as a vote to close our borders. As such there is no mandate for a anti immigration policy

attributes.action: Give young people of 13 years and over the right to vote in referenda.
attributes.background: I am 13.  People of my age will have to live with the decisions that adults made for us for years to come.  We need a say.  Young people are just as engaged as adults.  We have access to social media and information, and we take it in.  We want to secure our own futures.

attributes.action: Increase NHS and science research funding by £350 million per week
attributes.background: The leave campaign promised to redirect the money spent on EU membership to UK priorities, such as NHS and science funding. They should honour this promise, and increase funding for the NHS and science research by £350 million per week, which is what is spent by the UK on EU membership.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.voteleavetakecontrol.org/campaign - evidence that voters were promised increased funding for the NHS and science research by the leave campaign.

attributes.action: Work with the Commonwealth of Nations to establish an economic union
attributes.background: We call upon Her Majesty, the government and the British Parliament to actively seek cooperation with other commonwealth countries to establish a strong union/community that promotes greater social, political & economic harmony amongst those countries we have a strong historical relationships with.
attributes.additional_details: The people of the UK have voted to leave the EU, which will cause a huge economic impact. This vote is influenced by strong concerns regarding the legitimacy of a democratic mandate within the European Commission. There are also many constitutional questions this raises in terms of future arrangements between nations within the UK such as Scottish autonomy & Northern Ireland's relationship with Ireland. Commonwealth countries have already endorsed seeking free trade between commonwealth members.

attributes.action: Remove the 'triple lock' on pensions and protect the NHS from further cuts
attributes.background: Over 70% of pensioners backed the Leave vote to force Britain out of the EU and likely into a recession. The taxpayer pays more for pensions, than for healthcare, but unlike health the 'triple lock' on pensions guarantees increases of at least 2.5%, inflation or average earnings, whichever is higher
attributes.additional_details:
In 2015, £150bn was spent of taxpayer money on pensioners who voted to leave the EU. This looks certain to mean another recession and another round of austerity. The NHS can't take any more cuts, we were told during the referendum, so let's protect healthcare spending and cut pensions for those who clearly think we can afford a recession.
http://www.ukpublicspending.co.uk/budget_pie_ukgs.php

attributes.action: Referendum on making London a principality with right to remain in the EU
attributes.background: Following the overwhelming support from London voters for the UK to remain in the EU, we request that HM Government consider the option to allow London (as a principality of the U.K.) to remain in the EU - if necessary, following a second referendum/London-only vote.

attributes.action: Make London, Northern Ireland and Scotland an independent EU state.
attributes.background: The Majority of Scotland, Northern Ireland and London have voted to remain in the UK. So I ask Parliament to hold a referendum to make London Northern Ireland and Scotland a separate state of the European Union.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence as per EU Referendum results in press.

attributes.action: Bristol to receive a referendum to leave the UK and form an independent Nation
attributes.background: After vote leave won we believe that the United Kingdom does not speak or represent Bristol anymore and believe it better to move in a different direction from the UK

attributes.action: Call for an enquiry into false claims & advertising used in the EU Referendum
attributes.background: Both sides used false advertising and claims during the EU Referendum. It made for a completely confusing debate and made it extremely hard for the electorate to follow, and therefore tough to make an informed decision.

attributes.action: Don't Hold a General Election on account of result of EU Referendum
attributes.background:
The UK has now entered a period of unparalleled uncertainty and this uncertainty is the biggest threat to continuing UK financial stability. 
Financial markets are already unsettled as it is, and a General Election would prolong the uncertainty and economic fallout of Brexit, at everyone's expense.
attributes.additional_details: Uncertainty over the outcome of the EU Referendum already had a significant impact on the UK economy prior to this vote, with foreign direct investment being put on hold as well as stock markets and sterling becoming increasingly volatile. Now a vote to leave has prolonged this period of uncertainty and is likely to have a significant short term economic impact. It is vital that a General Election is not called to ensure that the financial fallout of Brexit is not prolonged for UK households.

attributes.action: A referendum for Independence for London, and the South East England Counties.
attributes.background: On the 23rd of June 2016 the United Kingdom voted to leave the EU. London & South East of England thrive on European trade and intrinsic links to global wealth and trade that it brings.
attributes.additional_details: On the 23rd of June 2016 the United Kingdom held a referendum to on Europe. The local economies of "L&SE" (London and the South East) are driven by our intrinsic links to global trade and global wealth, and services to be provided around this. The EU is a vital component of these links.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for any MP to tell lies in Parliament, or to the Public.
attributes.background: It is totally unfair that MP's can consider that their jobs allows them to be dishonest with both Parliament, and the General Public, with no consequences.
attributes.additional_details: Take a look at how many MP's have been accused of lying in the Euro Debate.  How are the Public meant to know what to vote for, when all they are hearing are called lies!

attributes.action: Decrease length of employment time needed to qualify for paternity leave.
attributes.background: I hadn't realised until recently how poor paternity rights in this country are. It is unfair and ridiculous that a man needs to have worked 26 weeks, 15 weeks before the due date, at a company in order to simply qualify for 1 week off work to spend time with his child and the mother.
attributes.additional_details: This is completely disproportionate to the amount of time the father gets off work. It is an important time for both parents as they bond with their child, and indeed a difficult time as they both learn to be parents. It is against every idea of fairness and equality, British values, that fathers do not automatically qualify for at least 1 week for paternity. The length of time they have to have worked there simply must be reduced, and for that matter they should be able to apply for more.

attributes.action: Free swimming concessions for elderly on a national basis.
attributes.background: To increase health and activity of older population at all public pools . Older people have limited income so free swimming would encourage healthier lifestyle.  Pools are paid out of council tax so should benifit local elderly .

attributes.action: Make the government increase funds to support youth mental health.
attributes.background:
Due to national bed shortages in mental health units, many young people have been forced to move over 200 miles away from home, leaving loved ones behind.

0.6% of the NHS budget goes into helping young people with mental health, this is not enough.

attributes.action: Introduce a 3 strike policy before benefits can be sanctioned.
attributes.background: The use of automatic benefit sanctions is littered with examples of hardship incurred to those being sanctioned. There is no evidence that automatic benefit sanctions "help" people into work. It takes time to find a job, however anybody can have an emergency which causes them to miss an appointment.
attributes.additional_details:
http://tfne.ws/1him6Lp - "Half of all DWP sanctions wrongly imposed"
http://bit.ly/1Yex8Tr - "Warning vulnerable families are being pushed into poverty by wrongly imposed benefit sanctions"
http://bit.ly/1TYFXki - "A list of completely ridiculous benefit sanctions people have experienced"

attributes.action: Force childcare providers to cap escalating and over priced childcare costs
attributes.background: Since my son has been in private nursery, we have paid £14000. My son has been in nursery for 13 months! Over the course of two years, we would have paid £25000 which is enough for a deposit on a house. This is obscene and believe that childcare should be capped to no more than £45 per day.
attributes.additional_details: Not only do parents have to pay for bank holidays but also for family holidays making it near impossible to go on holiday for some families. Many parents earn nothing after paying childcare fees but yet we are urged to work. With some childcare providers charging in excess of £90 per day, how are we supposed to pay these costs?

attributes.action: Publish all UK accounts in regard to EU & the Commons debate & scrutinise them.
attributes.background:
To make an informed decision at the referendum
I need to see with immediate effect all the UK accounts & contractual documents in regard to the EEC/EU
This will include all monies etc going to or from the EU
AND
all monies etc given out in the UK listing exactly without exception all recipients.
attributes.additional_details:
The complete accounts & documents to be openly published on the Government website.
The EU have failed to openly publish their accounts for over 18 years
& report said money is lost in corruption.
I am sick of hearing both sides referring to reports that are not always independent.
A full open audit will expose the truth & facts.

Without this evidence
As with any contract unless I can read & consider the terms & conditions then I will refuse to sign it.
In this case I will Vote to Leave the EU.

attributes.action: Create a separate loan that caters for accommodation for university students
attributes.background: Many student loans barely cover the cost of accommodation, so how will students from low income families go to the university of their choice when accommodation is more than the loan they are entitled to? This leaves many students in a deficit before they've even paid for anything.
attributes.additional_details: With an extra loan that caters for accommodation students will not have debt on their shoulders as soon as they start university, and can start focusing on more important things like the education itself. If grants are scrapped, at least bring something new and realistic to the table? This way less students will be tied between going to university or not because of the expenses, and will have easier access to a higher education letting students from 'low income families' have a better chance.

attributes.action: Stop allowing supermarkets to sell cheap alcohol.
attributes.background: The Pub Trade is dying, supermarkets are allowed to sell cheap alcohol which allows people to drink to excess and cause more stress on the NHS Police and other emergency services.  pubs are not allowed to do this by law.
attributes.additional_details:
All the major supermarkets are allowed to do the promotions i.e selling a litre of Vodka for aprox £15.
This stops people visiting bars and keeping them alive, pubs are being turned into shops and the community is losing out with having no where to go to celebrate birthdays etc.
We need to act now and save our pub's and clubs from disappearing .

attributes.action: Stop job discrimination against returning British Citizens
attributes.background: Government Departments have subcontracted recruitment companies (E.g. Capita) to manage the recruitment on their behalf. Some of these companies do not put forward candidates who have no been living in the UK for the past 3 - 5 years. This excludes British Citizens from working in the UK.

attributes.action: Make it Illegal to ignore the "No Junk Mail" and "No Callers" Door signs
attributes.background: The "Junk Mail" and "No Callers"  signs are placed on doors by residents in an attempt to stop the need to deal with this menace. But because there is no legal requirement, the wishes of these residents are ignored, and the rights of the residents to not be harassed in their own home are violated.
attributes.additional_details: This type of law is already in place in countries like Australia, and USA

attributes.action: Replace extortionate fees (24%) charged to parents by CMS with standard fee.
attributes.background: Paying parent pays 20% - receiving parent pays 4% to CMS for setting up direct debit.  Fees are disproportionate to the effort required by CMS to effect payment.  Fees are significantly more than fees charged to make simple bank transfer or BACS payment, regardless of the amount involved.
attributes.additional_details: The 24% charge is a standard charge, whether payment is £1 or £1000.  This fee amounts to a lot for some paying parents and represents money that could be better spent on the children.  The CMS should at least explain the reasons for this extortionate fee level, and be transparent about what they actually do to deserve such a fee.  Monies already paid by parents should receive a refund along the lines of the PPI scandal.  (Will give CMS something to do!)

attributes.action: Stop taxing and means testing veterans service pensions
attributes.background: Veterans are not benefing from their service pensions due to taxation and means testing .

attributes.action: Introduce laws to prevent companies using pension funds for any other purpose
attributes.background: Companies are continually reporting a black hole in pension funds also when companies go bust the pension fund is empty.

attributes.action: Exemption of the 3% tax levy on parents helping their children to buy a home.
attributes.background: Helping children to buy homes should not be taxed. The money being used by parents has already been taxed twice as salary and as savings. This law is morally corrupt.

attributes.action: Disband the polices current internal complaints investigation Service & the IPCC
attributes.background:
Two years ago the government voted to allow police to investigate All matters internally.

Instead of putting all cases, of police assualts against civilians or common law breaches, straight to the CPS, 

They now get a chance to cover up the matter or potentially 'falsify' the evidence.
attributes.additional_details:
The current police complaints system, is currently full of potential:

1. Corruption.

2. Conflict of interest - of the investigators knowing the person or persons that they are investigating.

3. Power or knowledge to potentially contaminate the incidence.

4. Potential or knowledge of how to falsify the evidence and manipulate the witness's:

    A. By only asking the right question or by
    misleading the witness into saying the right 
    answer, to allow the true police criminal to walk.

attributes.action: Make polygamy a specific criminal offence
attributes.background: Bigamy is a criminal offence in the UK and it therefor makes no sense for polygamy not to be a criminal offence.
attributes.additional_details: House of Commons Briefing Paper number 05051 dated 6th January 2016.

attributes.action: Make an INDEPENDENT EU booklet - facts, figures, forecasts if we STAY + if we GO
attributes.background: The EU Referendum is producing a blizzard of numbers, claims, guesses - it is virtually impossible for voters to assess properly the facts as they stand, or to get a balanced set of forecasts on the implications of either result. Without this information, the public cannot be asked to make a choice.
attributes.additional_details:
An independently produced booklet, perhaps no bigger the governments already produced booklet on why we should vote to stay, can be quickly produced to present first the facts as they stand and then the general expert views on what are the implications for the country if we vote to stay and if we vote to go.
Without giving voters a proper opportunity to assess both the facts and the body of opinion for both options in order to make their informed choice, we undermine democracy itself.

attributes.action: stop means testing carers allowance
attributes.background: us carers work hard to support our friends and family with dissabilities and yet we get money deducted from esa child tax working tax if we claim carers this is wrong.its a small price the goverment pay to us and then they take it back from other means,its wrong!!!

attributes.action: Restrict the maximum working hours of NHS staff to avoid mistakes being made.
attributes.background: This petition calls for the creation of legislation which limits the working hours of health care professionals who make decisions which affect patient safety, with the aim of preventing mistakes due to tiredness. It should be similar to GB and EU rules which restrict working hours for drivers.
attributes.additional_details:
Working long hours can lead to tiredness, which in turn can lead to dangerous mistakes being made. This is the reason for the existence of both GB domestic and EU legislation which restricts the number of hours drivers can work for in a week, how long they can drive for without a break and how long their breaks must be.

As NHS staff are often in situations at work where making a mistake can have extremely serious affects on patients health, a safe legal limit to working hours should apply.

attributes.action: No confidence vote in Amber Rudd for denying visa to bone marrow donor.
attributes.background: May Brown, 23, from Dorset, who has leukaemia, has been told that her Nigerian sister Martha is a "10 out of 10" tissue match.  However, the Home Office denied a visa because "all visa applications must be assessed against the immigration rules".
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-dorset-37656377
